page.title: 11BROCKWEIR VILLAGE TODAY
page.content: Brockweir village is inhabited main- ly by immigrants,there are very few locally born residents.There is no local industry apart from a family run riding school and a small Oil distrib- ution business.The village is a 'dormitory'as most residents travel out to work in Chepstow,Newport,Bris- tol and Monmouth. Village life is centred on the Mackenzie hall where the playgroup is held twice a week.There is a weekly Keep fit class,monthly whist drives, monthly Parish council meetings and Womens Institute.Various fund raising events such as jumble sales,Flea Mark- ets,dances and discos are also held in the hall.The Moravian church near the river was founded in 1831 and services are held on Sunday evenings and Sunday school in the morning is attended by about 20-30 children.
